quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 11 Quiz 5
quiz.subtitle: 11.5: Graphs of Sine and Cosine Functions
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Basic period and amplitude of sinusoidal graphs

questions.question: What is the period of the parent function $y = \sin(x)$?
questions.explanation: A full cycle of the sine function occurs once every $2\pi$ radians (or 360 degrees).

questions.question: What is the amplitude of the function $y = 3\cos(x)$?
questions.explanation: The amplitude is the absolute value of the coefficient $a$ in $y = a\cos(x)$. Here, it is 3.

questions.question: Which of the following points is the y-intercept of the parent cosine function $y = \cos(x)$?
questions.explanation: Since $\cos(0) = 1$, the graph of the parent cosine function begins at its maximum point on the y-axis.

questions.question: A graphing app costs $\$5$ and shows that the range of the parent sine function is:
questions.explanation: The parent sine function $y = \sin(x)$ oscillates between a minimum value of $-1$ and a maximum value of $1$.

questions.question: What is the amplitude of the function $y = -4\sin(x)$?
questions.explanation: Amplitude is always a positive distance. $|-4| = 4$.

questions.question: If the period of a sinusoidal function is $\pi$, how many full cycles are completed between $0$ and $2\pi$?
questions.explanation: If one cycle takes $\pi$, then two cycles will fit into a $2\pi$ interval.

questions.question: At which of the following values does the parent sine function $y = \sin(x)$ cross the x-axis?
questions.explanation: Sine is zero at $0, \pi, 2\pi$, etc. Therefore, it crosses the x-axis at $\pi$.

questions.question: A student pays \$15 for a textbook that defines the 'midline' of a trig graph. What is the midline of the parent function $y = \cos(x)$?
questions.explanation: The midline is the horizontal axis around which the graph oscillates. For the parent function, this is the x-axis ($y = 0$).

questions.question: What is the maximum value of the function $y = 5\sin(x)$?
questions.explanation: The maximum value is the midline (0) plus the amplitude (5).

questions.question: Which function has the same graph as $y = \sin(x)$ but shifted $\pi/2$ units to the left?
questions.explanation: Sine and Cosine are 'co-functions.' Shifting the sine graph left by 90 degrees ($\pi/2$) aligns it perfectly with the cosine graph.

scoreMessages.90: Great work! You have a clear picture of how these waves behave.
scoreMessages.70: Good job. Remember: Amplitude is always positive!
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on the starting points of sine vs. cosine.
scoreMessages.0: Review the parent graphs. Sine starts at the origin; cosine starts at the peak.
